doc:
Anne Shelton (singer) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anne_Shelton_(singer) 0 Anne Shelton (born Patricia Jacqueline Sibley, 10 November 1923 – 31 July 1994) was a popular English vocalist, who is remembered for providing inspirational songs for soldiers both on radio broadcasts, and in person, at British military bases during the Second World War. Shelton was also the original British singer of the Lale Anderson German love-song "Lili Marlene". Anne_Shelton ( born Patricia_Jacqueline_Sibley , 10_November_1923 – 31_July_1994 ) was a_popular_English_vocalist , who is_remembered for providing inspirational_songs for soldiers both on radio_broadcasts , and in person , at British_military_bases during the_Second_World_War . Shelton was also the_original_British_singer of the_Lale_Anderson_German_love-song_"_Lili_Marlene_" .
